member.name: IMediaSample.GetActualDataLength

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetActualDataLength method retrieves the length of the valid data in the buffer.

member.returns: Returns the length of the valid data, in bytes.

member.name: IMediaSample.GetMediaTime

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetMediaTime method retrieves the media times for this sample.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the media start time.
Pointer to a variable that receives the media stop time.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Media times are not set on this sample.

member.name: IMediaSample.GetMediaType

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetMediaType method retrieves the media type, if the media type differs from the previous sample.

member.param: Address of a variable that receives a pointer to an structure. If the media type has not changed from the previous sample, *ppMediaType is set to NULL.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The media type has not changed from the previous sample.

member.name: IMediaSample.GetPointer

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetPointer method retrieves a read/write pointer to the media sample's buffer.

member.param: Receives a pointer to the buffer.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

member.name: IMediaSample.GetSize

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetSize method retrieves the size of the buffer.

member.returns: Returns the size of the buffer, in bytes. The size does not include the prefix bytes, if any.

member.name: IMediaSample.GetTime

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetTime method retrieves the stream times at which this sample should begin and finish.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the start time.
Pointer to a variable that receives the stop time. If the sample has no stop time, the value is set to the start time plus one.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

listheader.description: Success. The sample has valid start and stop times.
The sample has a valid start time, but no stop time.

member.name: IMediaSample.IsDiscontinuity

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IsDiscontinuity method determines if this sample represents a break in the data stream.

member.returns: Returns S_OK if the sample is a break in the data stream. Otherwise, returns S_FALSE.

member.name: IMediaSample.IsPreroll

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IsPreroll method determines if this sample is a preroll sample. A preroll sample should not be displayed.

member.returns: Returns S_OK if the sample is a preroll sample. Otherwise, returns S_FALSE.

member.name: IMediaSample.IsSyncPoint

Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IsSyncPoint method determines if the beginning of this sample is a synchronization point.

member.returns: Returns S_OK if the sample is a synchronization point. Otherwise, returns S_FALSE.

listheader.description: Length specified in lLen is larger than the buffer size.

member.name: IMediaSample.SetDiscontinuity

Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetDiscontinuity method specifies whether this sample represents a break in the data stream.

member.param: Boolean value that specifies whether this sample is a discontinuity. If TRUE, the media sample is discontinuous with the previous sample.
member.returns: Returns S_OK, or an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

member.name: IMediaSample.SetTime

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. The SetTime method sets the stream times when this sample should begin and finish.

member.returns: Returns S_OK, or HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IMediaSample interface sets and retrieves properties on media samples. A media sample is a COM object that contains a block of media data. Media samples support the use of shared memory buffers among filters.

Typically, applications do not call methods on this interface. Filters use this interface to set properties on samples, and deliver the samples to a downstream filter. The downstream filter uses the interface to retrieve the properties and read the data. The filter can modify the data in place, or it can copy the sample, modify the copy, and pass the copy downstream.
The interface inherits this interface.
